data.name: TorrentsView_ClearTextFilter
data.value: Clear text filter (does not clear other filter settings)

data.name: TorrentsView_OtherFilterClear
data.value: Just clear these filters, not the text filter

data.name: TorrentsView_OpenNewCatDialog
data.value: Opens dialog to add new category

data.name: TorrentsView_MaxGlobalLimitInSettings
data.value: Max = Global limit defined in settings

data.name: TorrentsView_DlFirstAndLastFirst
data.value: Download first and last piece first

data.name: TorrentsView_TorrentCompleteCannotLimit
data.value: Because the torrent is completed the limit cannot be set

data.name: TorrentsView_MomentLocatingRoot
data.value: One moment - Locating root directory or file

data.name: TorrentsView_ResolveErrorsOrEsc
data.value: Either resolve the errors below or use the escape key to restore the old value

data.name: RssPlugin_GenerateInput
data.value: Input to generate a rule from

data.name: TorrentsViewModel_UnsetSelectedTorrentMessage
data.value: Should clear the API calls for torrent info and set the state of torrent control buttons

data.name: TorrentsViewModel_SelectedTorrentMessage
data.value: Should get the API calls for torrent info going and set the state of torrent control buttons

data.name: TorrentInfoViewModel_ForcedPrefix
data.comment: First letter of the 'Forced' word in square brackets

data.name: TorrentInfoViewModel_Seeded
data.comment: Keep it short, in a width restricted column

data.name: MainWindow_PluginsToolTip
data.value: Configure search plugins, search and download from within the app

data.name: MainWindow_RssRulesToolTip
data.value: Add rules to RSS feeds to automate downloads

data.name: MainWindow_RssRulesToolTipNote
data.value: Requires RSS feeds to be added to be useful

data.name: MainWindow_ShowSmartFilterToolTip
data.value: Going by online reports this does not seem to work. Hide it to save space.

data.name: MainWindow_LanguageDescription
data.value: QBC needs to be restarted for the language to be applied

data.name: MainWindow_OpenDataLinkToolTip
data.value: The session in this app won't carry over to your browser so what you see there is likely to differ from the response here

data.name: MainWindow_NoOptionCheckedNoDataWarning
data.value: All options are unchecked, there will be nothing to display

data.name: MainWindow_PauseLoggingToolTip
data.value: Note that this just pauses the logging, the requests will continue to happen

data.name: MainWindow_ProblemConnectingToHost
data.value: A problem occurred trying to connect to the host

data.name: SearchView_SearchPluginInstalledCount
data.comment: {} has to start with {} and the amount of installed plugins is inserted at the {0} position

data.name: SearchView_SearchesArePerformedOnThisDevice
data.value: Searches are performed on this device

data.name: SearchView_DownloadPythonToDownloadLocal
data.value: Download python to enable local searches

data.name: SearchView_SearchesProxiedThroughHost
data.value: Searches are proxied through the host

data.name: SearchView_SearchModeChangeClearsTabs
data.value: Changing search mode clears all open tabs

data.name: SearchView_ClickIconToOpenSearchPluginManager
data.value: Click the he icon to open the search engine manager

data.name: SearchView_AtLeastOneSearchPlugin
data.value: The number indicates how many search plugins are installed. You need to have at least one search plugin installed in order to search.

data.name: SearchView_HowToRemovePlugins
data.value: Use the search plugin manager to add and remove search plugins.

data.name: SearchView_HowToSwitchMode
data.value: The down arrow will open the dropdown menu allowing you switch between Local and Proxied mode.

data.name: SearchView_RemoteSearchDescription
data.value: Searches the same way as the WebUI. Every search is send to to the host (qBittorrent), which sends it to the site associated with the search engine, which gets send back to qBittorent. Then this app at a set interval pulls in the results.

data.name: SearchView_RemoteSearchCon
data.value: A lot of steps, a lot of delays. Can be quite slow to use.

data.name: SearchView_LocalSearchDescription
data.value: A search is send to the site associated with the search engine and straight back to the app.

data.name: SearchView_LocalSearchPro
data.value: A lot less steps, a lot faster!

data.name: SearchView_SameSearchSystem
data.value: The search plugin will run on this very machine, the same plugin system as qBittorrent uses is used.

data.name: SearchView_PythonInstalledGoodNews
data.value: Which requires Python 3+, the good news is that you already installed: {0}

data.name: SearchView_FirstColumnIcon
data.value: The icon in the first column indicates the action that's executed when double clicking a search result.

data.name: TextView_MagnetOrTorrentLink
data.value: Link starts with :magnet or ends on .torrent

data.name: SearchView_DotHtml
data.value: Detected .html extension, will open in browser.

data.name: SearchView_CheckLinktype
data.value: File type undetermined, run check and either download or open in browser.

data.name: SearchView_ShowingXOutOfY
data.comment: {0} inserts currently displayed result count, {1} inserts total result count

data.name: RssFeedsView_MarkAllArticlesForFeedAsRead
data.value: Marks all articles belonging to this feed as read

data.name: RssFeedsView_IfBlankTitleIsUsed
data.value: Title of the feed is used if left blank

data.name: RssFeedsView_RefreshAllNotJustThis
data.value: Refreshes all RSS Feeds and Articles - not just this entry

data.name: RssRuleView_IfRegexRedInvalid
data.value: If the background gets tinted red the regular expression is invalid

data.name: RssRuleView_WildcardAsterisk
data.value: • * to match zero or more characters

data.name: RssRuleView_WildcardWhitespace
data.value: • White-spaces count and AND operators (all words, any order)

data.name: RssRuleView_WildcardPipe
data.value: • | is used as a or operator

data.name: RssRuleView_IfWordOrderIsImportant
data.value: If word order is important use * instead of white-space.

data.name: RssRuleView_EmptyPipeClause
data.value: An expression with an empty | clause (e.g. expre|) will match all articles.

data.name: RssRuleView_MatchEpisodeFilter
data.value: Matches articles based on episode filter.

data.name: RssRuleView_EpFilterExample
data.value: Example: 1x2;8-15;5;30-; will match 2, 5, 8 through 15, 30 and onward episodes of season one.

data.name: RssRuleView_EpRuleEpNumberMandatory
data.value: • Season number is a mandatory non-zero value

data.name: RssRuleView_EpRuleEpNumberMandatoryPositive
data.value: • Episode number is a mandatory positive value

data.name: RssRuleView_EpRuleThreeRanges
data.value: • Three range types for episodes are supported:

data.name: RssRuleView_EpRuleRangeOne
data.value: • Single number: 1x25; matches episode 25 of season one
data.comment: Double space at the start is relevant

data.name: RssRuleView_EpRuleRangeTwo
data.value: • Infinite range number: 1x25-; matches episodes 25 and upward of season one
data.comment: Double space at the start is relevant

data.name: RssRuleView_EpRuleRangeThree
data.value: • Normal range: 1x25-40; matches episodes 25 through 40 of season one
data.comment: Double space at the start is relevant

data.name: RssRuleView_NameOfTheRuleDescription
data.value: Something unique that's easy to remember, like the name of what to download

data.name: RssRuleView_FilterMustContainDescription
data.value: The must contain/must not contain fields behave very differently depending on the state of this setting.

data.name: RssRuleView_FilterMustContainDescription2
data.value: The tooltips on them will automatically adjust to reflect what they do

data.name: RssRuleView_SmartFilterDescription1
data.value: If enabled the string must match one of the regular expressions that can be found under and edited in the remote settings RSS section.

data.name: RssRuleView_SmartFilterDescription2
data.value: Seems to be non-functional going by online reports so the preview doesn't take it into account either.

data.name: RssRuleView_CategoryToolTip
data.value: Categories can have a save path assigned to them. If this is the case the save to textbox below will reflect it, it can be overwritten by manually assigning a different path.

data.name: RssRuleView_TagDescription
data.value: RSS rule tags are created when the rule makes a match and adds a download. This can be circumvented by creating the tag before a match on the left side.

data.name: RssRuleView_ExistingTags
data.value: These tags already exist, select them for use with this rule

data.name: RssRuleView_ExistingTagsDescription
data.value: When adding it here it will be created immediately and made available for use here and elsewhere

data.name: RssRuleView_RemoveUntickLabelDescription
data.value: The remove button removes the tag from qBittorent not just the rule. Simply unticking the checkbox will prevent the tag from being applied to this rule.

data.name: RssRuleView_DisplayWarningToggle
data.value: The display of warnings can be toggled on and off

data.name: RssRulesView_ClearDownloadedEps
data.value: Are you sure you want to clear the list of downloaded episodes for this rule?

data.name: RssRulesView_SwitchToEdit
data.value: Switches the selected row to edit mode allowing modification of its name

data.name: RssRulesView_RowMustBeSelected
data.value: A row needs to selected for it to be enabled

data.name: RssRulesView_TestDataDescription
data.value: Test Data is not part of the WebUI but a feature offered by QBittorrent Companion.

data.name: RssRulesView_TestDataDescription2
data.value: Simply add whatever you want to test matching on in the table below and it will automatically be saved to this device for the currently selected rule

data.name: RssRulesView_ToggleRegular
data.value: * Regular view: Show a combobox for rule selection

data.name: RssRulesView_ToggleExpanded
data.value: * Expanded view: Show a listbox for rule selection (moves rule controls around)

data.name: RssRulesView_RefreshAllRules
data.value: Refreshes all rules, will undo selection

data.name: RssRulesView_ShowAddRuleControls
data.value: Shows flyout to add a new rule

data.name: RssRulesView_SelectOrAddNewRule
data.value: Select a rule, or enter a new one below

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_ShowAdditionalControls
data.value: Show additional controls to add search plugin through a web link (http://, or https://)

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_PurgePy
data.value: Purges .py files from the search engine directory that aren't recognized as a search engine (deletes the files).

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_DeleteSelectedPlugin
data.value: Deletes the selected plugin by removing the .py file from your disk (cannot be undone).

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_OpenDirectoryToolTip
data.value: Open the plugins directory. Placing search engine plugin .py files in this directory should make them show up below.

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_RefreshToolTip
data.value: qBittorrent Companion monitors the plugin directory and adding or deleting .py files to it should automatically trigger a refresh. This button lets you do the same manually.

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_SearchPluginUri
data.value: http:// or https:// URL linking to a python file

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_LinkToPtyhonFile
data.value: Web link to a python file, has to be an URL starting with http:// or https:// and point towards a python file

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_FileLink
data.value: file:/// URI pointing towards a python file that is on the host

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_ParseWiki
data.value: Loads the wiki page and parses it for search engine plugin info which will refresh the list below. If nothing shows up you should file a bug report on the qBittorrent Companion github page.

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_OpenGithubSpWiki
data.value: Open github qBittorrent search plugins page

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_OpenGithubSpWikiToolTip
data.value: The list below is obtained by parsing a github wiki page, click this button to visit the page if you prefer doing things manually.

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_ThirdPartyPluginWarning
data.value: Plugins are by third parties and may contain malicious code

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_CopyrightInfo
data.value: Be sure to comply with your country's copyright laws when downloading torrents from any of these search engines.

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_LocalSearchPluginTitle
data.value: Local search plugin manager - qBittorrent Companion

data.name: SearchPluginsControl_ServerSearchPluginTitle
data.value: Server search plugin manager - qBittorrent Companion

data.name: SearchPluginsViewModelBase_MustBeUri
data.value: Must be a file:/// or http(s):// URI

data.name: SearchPluginsViewModelBase_FailedToLocateSearchPluginTable
data.value: Failed to locate search plugin tables

data.name: GeneralSettingsView_Description1
data.value: When a torrent is added by a manual but external action (clicking a link, opening a .torrent file), should QBC present an options window or should the torrent simply be added?

data.name: GeneralSettingsView_Description2
data.value: The options window allows for assigning category/tags setting the download location, assigning speed limits etc.

data.name: IconCustomPreview_UndoToolTip
data.value: Undo the last color change. Use the dropdown for the entire history of changes.

data.name: IconCustomPreview_RedoTooltip
data.value: Redo the last undo, or see the dropdown for the entire 'forward' history

data.name: IconCustomPreview_ImportToolTip1
data.value: Although .svg is supported for importing and exporting it's not recommended for importing.

data.name: IconCustomPreview_ImportToolTip2
data.value: The .json format is recommended for importing as it's less error prone and uses less storage space.

data.name: IconCustomPreview_ExportSvgDescription
data.value: Not recommended for importing, but useful if you want an image

data.name: IconCustomPreview_Save1
data.value: 1) Saves the color profile under a date/timestamped file name in json format

data.name: IconCustomPreview_Save2
data.value: 2) Saves the new icon as a .ico file

data.name: IconCustomPreview_Save3
data.value: 3) Apply the icon to all open windows

data.name: IconCustomPreview_Save4
data.value: Keep in mind that if you save for dark mode whilst in light mode (or vice versa) the icon won't be applied

data.name: NotificationsView_SuspendNativeNotifications1
data.value: Suspends all native notifications allowing you to focus on other tasks and prevents them from overlaying over things like games.

data.name: NotificationsView_SuspendNativeNotifications2
data.value: Once they're enabled again all suspended notifications will be displayed.

data.name: NotificationsView_ShowNotificationOnEvent
data.value: Display a notification whenever one of the events specified below occurs

data.name: NotificationsView_IfBothOptionsAreEnabled
data.value: If both options are enabled the native notification is only used when QBC is minimized or running from the system tray.

data.name: NotificationsView_FinishedDownloadCondition
data.value: Triggered when a torrents 'completed on' date gets filled in

data.name: NotificationsView_TorrentAddedDelay
data.value: Only triggered from the API side, so when adding the torrent in QBC there might be a slight delay before the API picks up on it and triggers the notification.

data.name: NotificationsView_InAppNotificationNotRequired
data.value: No need for an in app notification, the login window will pop up instead.

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_AddDirectoryToolTip
data.value: Add a new directory to monitor

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_AddDirectoryFlyout
data.value: When adding a directory select this option by default:

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_AddDirectoryFlyoutRename
data.value: When renaming files, make the extension:

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_AddDirectoryLongDescription
data.value: Monitored directories will automatically have any .torrent files placed in them added to downloads. Once added the file will be: moved elsewhere, have .{0} added behind the .torrent extension or simply be deleted.
data.comment: Needs to have {0} to show the current rename extension

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_NoDirectoriesAddedYet
data.value: no directories have been added yet

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_ThisDirectoryDoesNotExist
data.value: This directory does not seem to exist, create it or change the path if you want this entry to do anything.

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_ShareTimeToolTip
data.value: Specify the time other users are allowed to download this torrent from you. Once this time is exceeded (or another limit is met) sharing is disabled.

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_ShareTimeToolTipNoteContent
data.value: This is the time others are actively downloading from you, not the amount of time you have made it available

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_ShareTimeToolTipFootnote
data.value: If hidden or left blank sharing will continue indefinitely (unless another limit is set).

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_RatioToolTip1
data.value: Specify the ratio until sharing is stopped.

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_RatioToolTip2
data.value: A ratio of 1 would mean you share as much as you have downloaded (1 to 1 [1:1])

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_RatioToolTip3
data.value: A ratio of for example 0.5 would mean sharing half as much as you have downloaded

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_RatioToolTip4
data.value: If hidden or left blank sharing will continue indefinitely (unless another limit is set). A value of 0 would prohibit sharing.

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_LimitDownloadSpeedToolTip1
data.value: Specify the maximum speed this torrent is allowed to download at

data.name: MonitorDirectoriesView_LimitDownloadSpeedToolTip2
data.value: If hidden or set to blank or -1 no limit is enforced.

data.name: LaunchFilesView_Description
data.value: For this to work the files do need to be available on this system (for example through a windows network or NFS share). If they are, specify the directories below and you can launch files straight from qBittorrent Companion.

data.name: TempFileDir
data.value: Temporary files directory, for example W:\Temporary\

data.name: LaunchFilesView_OnDoubleClick
data.value: When double clicking a torrent or file

data.name: LaunchFilesView_LaunchFileExplorerFileSelected
data.value: Launch file explorer with the file selected

data.name: LocalSettingsWindow_SaveIconToolTip
data.value: If there's a save icon visible there's unsaved changes

data.name: LogInWindow_IpAddressToolTip1
data.value: The IP address. If you're using a WAN IP, make sure the relevant port is forwarded

data.name: LogInWindow_IpAddressToolTip2
data.value: The local domain (like 'localhost'), or remote domain if you have a DNS server configured

data.name: LogInWindow_PortToolTip
data.value: The port that's configured in qBittorrent itself to serve the web UI

data.name: LogInWindow_AttemptingToConnect
data.value: Attempting to connect to the provided address

data.name: LogInWindow_UrlIsValid
data.value: The URL is valid and appears to be a QBittorrent WebUI login page.

data.name: LogInWindow_StoreAuthenticationDataWarning
data.value: Storing authorization data inherently carries risks, the password will however be encrypted to offer some degree of protection.

data.name: LogInWindow_PasswordInMemoryWarning
data.value: To allow for reconnecting the password needs to be kept in memory which may pose a security risk. It will however be encrypted to offer some degree of protection.

data.name: LogInWindow_SaveLoginInfoToolTip
data.value: Saves the login information to local storage (the password will be encrypted, the rest is stored as plain text)

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_EnsureQbittorrentIsRunning
data.value: Ensure qBittorrent is running on your 'server'

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_HtmlWhereToDownload
data.value: It can be downloaded from http://qbittorrent.org - although if you're running Linux it's recommended to check the repositories first

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_EnsureWebUiIsEnabled
data.value: Ensure the WebUI is enabled and functional.

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_WhereToEnableWebUi
data.value: It can be enabled under Tools » Options » WebUI

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_HtmlWhereToCheckWebUi
data.value: Once the WebUI is enabled it should be accessible on the 'server' in a web brower by visiting http://127.0.0.1:8080.

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_HtmlTestWebUiOnThisDevice
data.value: Test on this device (the one running qBittorrent Companion) if you can access the WebUI by visiting http://server-ip-adress:8080 in a webbrowser.

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_HowToGetIp
data.value: (To figure out the servers ip, on it in a console run `ipconfig` for Windows or `ifconfig` for Linux)

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_AllGoodThenConnect
data.value: If you confirmed everything is enabled and should be working click the 'Login' tab above, fill in the same information and hit the 'Login' button.

data.name: LoginHelpMessageView_SaveDataDisclaimer
data.value: If you choose to save the login data qBittorrent Companion will store it in your user folder and use some basic encryption. This is a step up from storing it as plain text but far from being unhackable, do not use the same password elsewhere.

data.name: OwnAboutWindow_HtmlParagraph1
data.value:
This application is written in C# by Pascal Bakhuis using the Avalonia UI framework and can be freely downloaded from github.com/Axeia/qBittorrentCompanion (including the source code).
It leans heavily on the qbittorrent-net-client project by fedarovich.

data.name: OwnAboutWindow_HtmlParagraph2
data.value: For bug reports and feature requests please make use of the previously mentioned GitHub page.

data.name: OwnAboutWindow_HtmlParagraph3
data.value: The flag icons are by flagpedia.net - all the other icons are by Microsoft

data.name: RssRuleView_Warning
data.value: A rule should have something to match, ensure at least one of these fields has a value: 'Must contain', 'Must not contain' or 'Episode filter'

data.name: RssRuleView_EpisodeFilterInvalid
data.value: Episode filter isn't valid, perhaps it's incomplete?

data.name: RssRuleView_NotValidWildcard
data.value: Not a valid wildcard (or the live preview just can't be trusted)

data.name: DownloadsView_DefaultSettingsDescription
data.value: Default settings that get applied when adding a torrent

data.name: AddTorrentWindow_AddTorrentsThroughLink
data.value: Add torrents through magnet and/or .torrent links

data.name: AddTorrentWindow_FilesWatermark
data.value: Download torrents from .torrent or Magnet links - one link per line

data.name: AddTorrentFields_DownloadFirstLastFirst
data.value: Download first and last pieces first
